name: Tahira: Echoes of the Astral Empire
description: Guide Tahira, the 20-year old princess of Avestan, through the most challenging night of her life in this epic tactical turn-based adventure. You must fight to save your people from the genocidal Astral Empire on a world fallen into a medieval dark age after the collapse of a spacefaring civilisation.

reviews.review_text: I originally backed this game on kickstarter because the setting and story reminded me of a favorite book of mine, ?The Blue Sword.' The story is engaging, the turned based strategy is framilar without being tedius. I'm really loving this game!
I backed this game on Kickstarter and haven't been disappointed. I am finding the strategy of battles both simple to understand and challenging to master. I am particularly enjoying the music.

I really enjoyed this. I loved The Banner Saga and this seemed similar so it was inevitable that I would give it a shot. It is somewhat short, yet the atmosphere of the game is excellent and while very similar to TBS in visual style, it is still pleasing and fresh to look at.   The combat can be very hard on higher difficulties (played through one second hardest myself) but is very rewarding as a result of this. A somewhat confusing save system had me replaying quite a hard mission at one point but I actually didn't mind because I enjoyed the combat a lot. There isn't a huge amount of unit variety but I personally didn't mind this too much either because of the generally epic feel of the fights.   Worth the price in my opinion and I would gladly purchase a sequel :)

Turn-based fans will find a treat in this RPG hybrid. Graphics, while static mostly, are beautiful. The story, in a choose-your-own-adventure way, is absorbing. Recommended for turn-based players especially.

It's very easy to forget that Tahira is the first title of a three man development team. This game has clearly been made with a lot of love and thought, and has been presented with a compelling story accompanying interesting battle sequences. While I miss the Fire Emblem style of levelling up and character growth, it doesn't make sense in a story that takes place over one night. I also feel the developers have really made their game work in the context of guerrilla fighting against unlikely odds.  While the game pacing can feel odd at times, and the presence of some interesting bugs, this is largely to be expected during the early release period of a game, and doesn't detract from the rewarding experience that the game offers. I'm really looking forward to placing the game at different difficulties, and I'm excited to see where Whale Hammer Games goes in the future!
A lazy reviewer would call this a poor man's Banner Saga.  This is a poor man's Banner Saga. I would suggest buying that instead. Or replay if you already own it.   3/10
